title: Introduction to Linear Equations
subject: Mathematics
content:
# Linear Equations

A linear equation is an equation that makes a straight line when graphed. General form: ax + b = c

## Solving Methods
1. Addition/Subtraction: Perform same operation on both sides
2. Multiplication/Division: Isolate the variable

## Example
x + 5 = 12
x = 12 - 5
x = 7
author: algebra

title: Basic Mechanics Reference
subject: Physics
content:
# Newton's Laws

## First Law
An object at rest stays at rest, object in motion stays in motion unless acted upon by unbalanced force.

## Second Law
F = ma (Force equals mass times acceleration)

## Third Law
For every action, equal and opposite reaction.
author: newton

title: Periodic Table Fundamentals
subject: Chemistry
content:
# Periodic Table

## Organization
- Elements arranged by atomic number
- Groups: vertical columns (similar properties)
- Periods: horizontal rows

## Trends
- Atomic radius decreases across period, increases down group
- Ionization energy increases across period, decreases down group
author: elements
